intro: Paraixeris koidzumiana, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of a dill plant. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
